## README

- `transferrin.pdb` is [human](https://www.rcsb.org/structure/3V8X)

// The 3D structure is missing part of the sequence and starts w/ "KTVRW ..." instead of "MRLAV ...". 1SUV starts with "DKTVRW ..." -- how odd. Why remove the first couple of residues?

Figure 1B in Barber _et al._ translates exactly to the full sequence (MRLAV ...), for example, position E591 is `seq[590]` (pythonic 0-based indexing). The resulting ground truth positions are (using the original indexing):


```csv
L,153
P,253
V,382
S,434
D,435
N,436
D,439
P,558
N,574
E,575
K,576
E,591
E,592
Y,593
A,614
H,617
I,619
H,625
```


- primate transferrin:

> GenBank accession numbers of transferrin and TbpA variants are KM972645 to KM972665. -- https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/25504720/

> The human transferrin variant cloned was identical in sequence to the GenBank entry for the C1 variant (NM001063). -- same

// Starts "MRLAV ..."


```bash
# bonvinlab.org/pdb-tools/
pdb_selchain -B transferrin.pdb | pdb_delelem -H | pdb_selatom -CA,C,N,O | pdb_delhetatm | pdb_tidy | grep -v 'ANISO' > transferrin.clean.pdb
```


Sanity check indexing:


```python
from Bio.Seq import Seq


s = ''

aa = Seq(s).translate().__str__()

l = [153, 253, 382, 434, 435, 436, 439, 558, 574, 575, 576, 591, 592, 593, 614, 617, 619, 625]

assert "".join([aa[i - 1] for i in l]) == 'LPVSDNDPNEKEEYAHIH'
```
